title: How to Remove a Painting from a Frame

steps.title: Assess the damage to the painting.
steps.content: Assess the damage to the painting. If serious, you may need to hire a professional restorer.

steps.title: Examine the front and back of the frame.
steps.content: Examine the front and back of the frame. Determine the method of attachment. Removal is reversal of assembly. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Note which staples go to which part of the assembly.
steps.content: Note which staples go to which part of the assembly.

steps.title: Remove staples, nails or screws from back of frame.
steps.content: Remove staples, nails or screws from back of frame. [2] X Research source It is not necessary to take out the staples holding the stretcher bar itself. Use pliers to remove the staples if they don't come out easily. [3] X Research source Continue around the back of the picture.

steps.title: Carefully wedge in the screwdriver to get a grip on the spline.
steps.content: Carefully wedge in the screwdriver to get a grip on the spline.

steps.title: Remove the spline from all the way around the painting.
steps.content: Remove the spline from all the way around the painting.

steps.title: Pull any staples/nails found holding the canvas to the frame, being careful not to rip the canvas material too much.
steps.content: Pull any staples/nails found holding the canvas to the frame, being careful not to rip the canvas material too much. It may need to be re-attached to another stretcher bar if the current one is not reusable.

steps.title: Gently push the canvas backward or frame forward to separate from each other.
steps.content: Gently push the canvas backward or frame forward to separate from each other.

steps.title: Slowly poke under the canvas.
steps.content: Slowly poke under the canvas. [4] X Research source The wood stretcher bar holds the canvas giving it shape. There is a crevice into which the spline used to fit, pinching the canvas taut. This is the same principle a screen door uses.

steps.title: Continue around the edge of the frame/picture.
steps.content: Continue around the edge of the frame/picture. There may be many years that the canvas has been pressed folded. It is not glued to the wood, but may be stuck slightly.

steps.title: If transporting, carefully roll up around a foam cylinder and place in sturdy carton.
steps.content: If transporting, carefully roll up around a foam cylinder and place in sturdy carton. [5] X Research source Wrap loosely so paint does not chip and break off.
